cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government)
G.T.3234
SECRET.
OPERATIONS.
From: F.M. C-in-C, France.
To: C.I.G.S., War Office.
Despatched 12.4.a.m. 6.1.18.
Received 1.30.a.m. 6.1.18.
0.A.B./69.
G.0.C., R.F.C reports to me as follows:-
"Bombs were dropped on Maizieres - Les - Metz, the railway station at Failly, railway junction between Woippy and Devant le Pont, Courcelles, railway junction and railway bridge 4 miles south of Maizieres and on a train at Wurtemberg junction, in the raid carried out on the night of January 4th/5th, reported in Press communique. Owing to mist definite observation difficult. According to report of Pilots, defences greatly increased and lighting much more subdued. Operations prevented from being carried out on January 5th by clouds."
